messages.message:
getting an error trying to run RabbitMQ locally. the `rabbitmq_pass.py` file is getting an error about:
```File "/usr/local/bin/rabbitmq_pass.py", line 54, in _gen_hash

tmp0 = salt + password.encode('utf-8')

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'encode'```
@sudeep
you need to load the env file
RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS - the password environment variable is not set
ok sounds good, how do I load the env file?
+1 to @Anil's comment
is that the `docker_env_local.lsit`?
source tmp/docker_env_local.lsit
@Travis - how are you running rabbitmq btw?
through provisioner
in docker
can you do `make build-docker run-docker`
i actually do not use provisioner so have not seen how it's starting it up. but pretty sure the above should work and automatically source the env file etc
its crashing,
out of disk space it says

```2021-02-16 17:27:11.696 [info] <0.282.0> Running boot step pre_boot defined by app rabbit
2021-02-16 17:27:11.696 [info] <0.282.0> Running boot step rabbit_core_metrics defined by app rabbit
2021-02-16 17:27:11.696 [info] <0.282.0> Running boot step rabbit_alarm defined by app rabbit
2021-02-16 17:27:11.700 [info] <0.288.0> Memory high watermark set to 3185 MiB (3340720537 bytes) of 7964 MiB (8351801344 bytes) total
2021-02-16 17:27:11.704 [info] <0.290.0> Enabling free disk space monitoring
2021-02-16 17:27:11.704 [info] <0.290.0> Disk free limit set to 50MB

2021-02-16 17:27:11.707 [warning] <0.286.0> disk resource limit alarm set on node rabbit@922fb7b68ca5.```
I’ve cleaned and compiled a few times,
hmm :thinking_face: never seen that
and then when I try running the image from docker dashboard is where I get the password issue.

> and then when I try running the image from docker dashboard is where I get the password issue.
yeah because again the env vars are not there

```~/Sites/instabase/third-party/docker/rabbitmq(master) » source ./tmp/docker_env_local.list                                                                                    travislawrence@Traviss-MacBook-Pro
env: vars: No such file or directory
./tmp/docker_env_local.list:39: command not found: --password=nJMa3XknP!H63bPoxRF#UWraqCXEHd```

starts fine for me with make build-docker run-docker
```2021-02-16 17:29:54.333 [info] <0.899.0> Statistics database started.
2021-02-16 17:29:54.333 [info] <0.898.0> Starting worker pool 'management_worker_pool' with 3 processes in it

 * rabbitmq_prometheus

 * rabbitmq_management_agent

```2021-02-16 17:29:53.330 [info] <0.288.0> Memory high watermark set to 794 MiB (833272217 bytes) of 1986 MiB (2083180544 bytes) total
2021-02-16 17:29:53.347 [info] <0.290.0> Enabling free disk space monitoring
2021-02-16 17:29:53.347 [info] <0.290.0> Disk free limit set to 50MB```

@Travis can you do the following and retry
```docker system prune -a --volumes```
:running:
wow 37gb
haha
cool!
making and building again
one sec
funny, cause I’ve done `docker system prune` before (without the other flags)
and usually get about 1 or 2 gb back
okay - confirming this is all working now?
ok its up
thank you so much team!
great thanks for confirming!
